alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:53PM EST until December 19 at 5:39AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Missisquoi River Near North Troy affecting Orleans County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missisquoi River near North Troy. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water overflows onto farm lands from Lowell downstream to North Troy. At 9.0 feet, Water floods farmlands along the Missisquoi River from Lowell to North Troy. Low lying portions of Loop Road near Troy and Westfield will flood, as well as portions of River Road from Troy to North Troy. At 11.0 feet, Water will inundate River Road between Troy and North Troy, as well as portions of Loop Road in Westfield and Troy. Water will cover portions of Route 100 near Troy, and well upstream near Lowell. There will be widespread flooding of lowlands, fields, and pastures along the Missisquoi from Lowell to North Troy. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
